name: Collège Air Richelieu
about: Collège Air Richelieu, established in 1928, is a premier institution for pilot training in Canada. Located at the Montreal / St Hubert Regional Airport since 1971, the college has a rich history of producing highly skilled pilots, including astronauts and captains of prestigious airlines. As the first Approved Training Organisation (ATO) in Canada, Collège Air Richelieu offers a unique college diploma (DCS) integrated with the Airline Transport Pilot Licence (ATPL). The college boasts a modern fleet of over 30 aircraft, comprehensive facilities, and partnerships with Jazz Aviation, providing graduates direct access to career opportunities. With a strong focus on safety and professional development, Collège Air Richelieu continues to set the standard in aviation education.
services:
["Private Pilot License
Commercial Pilot License
Airline Transport Pilot
Flight Instructor (CFI / FI)
Instrument Rating (IR)
Multi-Engine Rating"]
